subject: The Big Man and the Redhead
event: I said that the big man could tell you the latest casting news. That's because the big guy is Ian McNeice, a veteran British character actor most recently seen on HBO as the newsreader in ROME. He's done a million other parts as well, of course. In A GAME OF THRONES, he'll be playing Illyrio Mopatis, Magister of the Free City of Pentos, merchant prince, and arch- conspirator. There is one character with a speaking part in the HBO pilot who did not appear in my novel. In the early drafts of the script she was known only as Red-Headed Whore, but she has since been christened "Ros." Playing Ros will be the lovely Esme Bianco, an actress, model, and burlesque performer whose website can be found at http://www.esmeforever.com/ Her previous credits include CHEMICAL WEDDING, BURLESQUE FAIRYTALES, and DEAD MAN RUNNING, which is where those clues about chemicals, fairies, and dead men came from. Tyrion will be very pleased to make her acquaintance.

comments.article:
Wow, I'm really, really impressed with the people that are getting cast for your miniseries.

Do you know if any of them are fans of your work?
He's dead-on for Illyrio.  Now we just need you to confirm Drogo and all will be right in the world ;)
I agree with this... GIVE US DROGO! =D

Oh, I thought this Big Man riddle was about ser Gregor...
Once you said that it's a difficult task to find a guy to play older Clegane.
I think that Russian boxing champion Valuev is a perfect pick :)

http://akboxing.ru/wp-content/uploads/2009/04/valuev.jpg

By the way, last year he starred in Russian movie 'Stone Head', so it's not really impossible!

Only the pilot is being cast, and that only covers the first few chapters of the book; Gregor would not appear.

Valuev's English is very heavily accented, isn't it? Don't think that would work unless he was dubbed.

Illyrio very good.))))
it is Illyrio ))0
Ian McNeice will be PERFECT as Illyrio! I can see it now... So excited for this series!
This.  I think he's going to be perfect as well.

McNeice is perfect as Illyrio.

Though, I guess it may be a little rude to say Esme Bianco is equally perfect as the Red-Headed Whore... sorry, "Ros".
Wow, perfect casting! I'm so excited :D

McNeice is a great actor, don't get me wrong. I'm sure he'll make a great Illyrio, too.

But for all that, I think he could have made a much better Varys. Given the much bigger role Varys plays in the tale, it would have been a better use of his acting talents.
comments.subject: McNeice is wasted on Illyrio

comments.article: for varys, i totally imagine the smarmy guy from sweeney todd/harry potter...timothy spall (http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0001758/)
comments.subject: Re: McNeice is wasted on Illyrio
Re: McNeice is wasted on Illyrio
Re: McNeice is wasted on Illyrio

comments.article: I really liked McNeice in ROME! This is exciting!

I'm sure Tyrion would be very pleased indeed.

I don't know if you've mentioned this, but who is writing the screenplay? It seems like I'd remember if you said it was you, and I assume you're working on some other book or another. To me, the writers of a TV show are more important than the actors.
McNeice was pretty cool when he read the news in ROME. I loved all his gestures.
comments.subject: Awesome choices!

comments.article: I've loved Ian McNeice ever since seeing him in Mel Brook's adaptation of 84 Charing Cross Road. My kids got to know who he was by watching the Donny Osmond version of Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, and of course he was wonderfully hideous in the television version of Dune. I also enjoyed him in The Englishman Who Went Up a Hill But Came Down a Mountain (although the book was better than the movie).
And don't forget his lovable Bert in Doc Martin!
Whores are like cookies. You never know how they will taste, and then it's too late.

I couldn't think of a better person to play Illyrio, he's been in mind sonce I read the book.
Annyoingly, for some reason I felt that Ian McNeice would also make a very good Varys.

comments.upictitle: Map-Maker, Lighthouse-Keeper: Listen the hell up
comments.article: Yay! love McNeice.
That might just be the best icon ever!
The last few castings have been dead-on.  But I don't like them playing around with your art, adding characters and such.  That ain't right.  No sir, it ain't!
comments.subject: Good/bad news

comments.article: The one thing I recognized Ian McNeice most for was his role as the Baron Harkonnen in the Sci Fi dune miniseries.
I TOTALLY CALLED IT!! Sorry I have to toot my own horn but the news reader in Rome is exactly who I picked for the big guy! Friggin perfect! Nice job.
comments.subject: ROME GUY!

comments.article: Ian McNeice was also in Ace Ventura 2: When Nature Calls! Dude's got range and chops...
comments.subject: Don't forget!

comments.article:
But were I in his place I'd try to forget ever appearing on that trashy little Dune mini-series.
Just being reminded of it brings to mind all the horrible things that can happen to a great series of novels in an adaptation to the screen. *shudder*

And I'd have to disagree with his compatibilty as Varis for one simple unfortunate reason- he's too fat.
Varis is simply plump, "rounded" at best, he's not even close in volume the gigantic Illyrio.
Unless you're willing to throw physical descriptions out the window just to have this or that famous actor.
comments.subject: Ian McNeice is a great actor.

comments.article:
Illyrio is perfect!
Esme Bianco really looks like a whore:)

Again: I cant wait....!!

She looks like she should be good for showing the sexy aspect of the production.  But I'm wondering if the pilot will be aired or maybe uploaded to vimeo or something at some point?  Maybe after it's green-lighted or whatever the term is for starting the actual movie/series?
comments.subject: Ros

comments.article: Two thumbs up, for Ilyrio!  I mean thumbs up, in the good sense!
Wow, she is a stunner!

I saw McNiece on stage a few years back and he was electric so looking forward to seeing him.
Esme Bianco looks amazing too so hope we get to see more of her
